Alexandra Cann was married on Martha's Vineyard on Saturday to Chris Ballard at the Old Whaling Church in Edgartown, Mass.

Alexandra Cann, the daughter of Marlene and Douglass Cann of Manchester-by-the-Sea, Mass., was married on Martha's Vineyard yesterday to Chris Ballard, a son of Dr. Roberta Ballard and Dr. Philip Ballard of Philadelphia. The Rev. Dr. Jerry Fritz, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony at the Old Whaling Church in Edgartown, Mass.
Mr. and Mrs. Ballard, both 30, received master's degrees in journalism from Columbia University, where they met.

The bride was until last month a seventh-grade literacy and social studies teacher at Intermediate School 98 in the Bronx. In September she is to become a language arts teacher at the Clinton School for Writers and Artists, a public middle school in Manhattan. She graduated cum laude from Colgate and in May received a master's degree in teaching from Fordham. Her father is an architect in Boston with Eckland Consultants, an architectural, engineering and environmental consulting firm. Her mother is a health science teacher at Hamilton Wenham Regional High School in South Hamilton, Mass.

The bridegroom is a staff writer for Sports Illustrated and the author of ''Hoops Nation: A Guide to America's Best Pickup Basketball'' (Henry Holt, 1998). He graduated from Pomona College. His mother is a professor of pediatrics, obstetrics and gynecology at the University of Pennsylvania. His father is the Dennis and Gisela Alter professor of pediatrics at Penn, and the director of neonatology research at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia.
